blog.name: thedemonphanti
blog.title: thedemonphanti
blog.description: Treat People With Respect | Unpopular Opinions Welcome

summary: do you ever like phils videos?
question: do you ever like phils videos?
answer: I liked his last one, reacting to himself on The Weakest Link. I think it worked because his reactions were genuine and they made me laugh out loud more than once. The two I haven’t liked recently were this one and the Google one. I think he is still trying to find his rhythm making solo content again, especially since his main channel featured joint content for so long even before the tour. It’s just a process that he’s going to have to go through if he wants to continue being a YouTuber on his own without relying on having Dan in videos with him. I really wouldn’t expect that to happen without some growing pains. Dan never featured Phil on his channel as Phil featured Dan, but I’m sure if he returns, his channel will face some growing pains as well. Dips and peaks as far as content quality goes are common with YouTubers and basically the ones who survive persist and adapt/evolve. It’s just the way it is. Not every video is going to be a home run for every person. Anyone who thinks that is possible is placing some pretty unrealistic expectations on Phil that I’m sure he doesn’t even have for himself.

blog.name: thedemonphanti
blog.title: thedemonphanti
blog.description: Treat People With Respect | Unpopular Opinions Welcome

summary: What did you think of Phil’s video? Meh if you ask me.
question: What did you think of Phil’s video? Meh if you ask me.
answer: Honestly? I thought it was a bit childish and recycled. That sounds really harsh, but I really don’t know how else to put it. Phil is 32 now so he has been living on his own without his parents for nearly as long as he lived with them, so the whole “oh no I’m going to do things I could never do because my parent’s wouldn’t let me” rings very false. Don’t get me wrong, I love nostalgia videos. Marzia used to have a little series where she had Felix find and download games she used to play as a child that I liked and I watched Zoe and Joe Sugg do a haul with toys from their childhood, but those videos worked because I could relate to the experience of seeing things that were so sentimental after such a long period of time and their excitement was genuine. Phil’s video might have worked for me in that way, but he had already done all of those things over the years and done them on social media. He mixed cereals together in the Manchester DITL. He and Dan made videos going on Omegle back when everyone used to do it. He and Dan have talked about being fans of horror movies over the years and watching videos far more shocking than the scene Phil reacted to here. I saw people post elsewhere that he had posted a photo of his face scanned before and that he had tried some form of carbonated milk when he was on tour. The problem I have with this video is the same that I had with his Google video and that is that the reactions aren’t real. He’s reacting to things he has already seen or done as if he was seeing or doing them for the first time and that tends to be lackluster no matter how charismatic the reactor. Plus he is trapped in that claustrophobic corner with the weird camera angle, which just seems awkward to me. I know there are a lot of people who love Phil’s videos the way they are and that’s great. I’m obviously not his target demographic and have always been more of a fan on Dan’s content, but, to answer the ask, this is basically why the video didn’t work for me. To me, this is another example of a video idea that someone like Jenna could probably pull off because she would really go all out and commit to being silly and doing something whimsical, but Phil just doesn’t commit that much to an idea these days and tends to be too reserved and fearful of, ironically, trying new things. I’d be really interested to hear what other people think though!
